results.title: The Explorers [Bill Peach]
results.brief_description: This series follows the trails of the men who opened up the great unknown areas of Australia in the nineteenth century, from the Blue Mountains to the great rivers and deserts.

results.title: The Explorer
results.creator_credit: Eltham Films, Patrick Ryan and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Albert Tucker (1914-) is an intellectual artist with great independence of mind and mental courage. He has succeeded in fashioning a distinctive style and is now one of the leading artists in Australia. This film is based on a series of paintings by Tucker which deals with an unnamed explorer who perished in the outback desert. Imaginative paintings in an imaginative film.

results.title: The Experiment = Das Experiment
results.creator_credit: Typhoon Pictures, Fanes Film, Senator Film Production, Norbert Preuss, Marc Conrad, Fritz Wildfeuer and Oliver Hirschbiegel
results.brief_description: In his directorial debut Oliver Hirschbiegel brings together a taut drama based on a novel by Mario Giordano (“Black Box”) about a human behaviour experiment. Offered 4000 marks, 20 men are recruited for a two-week experiment where they will role-play either prison inmates or guards. A journalist Tarek (Moritz Bleibtreu, of “Run Lola Run” fame) working mainly as a taxi driver takes part wearing high tech video-recording glasses. Once roles are assigned, uniforms are put on - militaristic ones for the guards and a simple numbered smock for the prisoners - and the rules for the experiment are made clear. Like a ‘Lord of The Flies’ but for adults locked in a cage with similarly shocking results - after only three days things go awry and the corruptible nature of power in the human psyche asserts itself. Dark and industrial setting with hard-rock sound track (‘Linkin Park’ are featured) add to the oppressive and harsh environment in which the story takes place. Cast includes Maren Eggert, Christian Bekel, Justus Von Dohnany and Oliver Stokowski. Bleibtreu won Best Actor for this role at two film festivals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Typhoon Pictures, Fanes Film, Senator Film Production, Norbert Preuss, Marc Conrad, Fritz Wildfeuer and Oliver Hirschbiegel

results.title: The Expedition of T. Mitchell
results.brief_description:
The arrival of T.Mitchell from the United Kingdom to Australia with convicts in tow. Subsequently one morning, T.Mitchell awoke to find his camp robbed by the convicts.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Expanding universe of sculpture
results.brief_description: Explores contemporary sculpture, using as examples works by artists, Reuben Nakina, Alex Leberman, David Burt, and Doris Chase who express their attitudes toward their work and the philosophy that motivates them. Includes a multi-media show which combines music, dance, light and sculpture and demonstrates the uses of a wide variety of materials.

results.title: The Exorcist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, William Peter Blatty and William Friedkin
results.brief_description: The Exorcist occupies a central position in the history of horror films, an almost sadistically malevolent experience in terror. Regan (Linda Blair) is a young girl entering puberty and she becomes possessed by the spirit of an ancient demon. Her mother (Ellen Burstyn) finds that there is no assistance in the scientific pragmatism of the modern world and she hesitantly turns to the occult rites of Catholicism and Orthodoxy in order to rid her daughter of the monster. The exorcism scenes attain a disturbing authenticity and they are based on the official Catholic Church rites of exorcism. “The Exorcist” is a film that feeds on our most intimate fears and terrors and not a film for the easily frightened. Stars Max Van Sydow as Father Merrin. Based on the book by William Peter Blatty. Mercedes McCambridge is the voice of the Devil. Part of Tubular Bell by Mike Oldfield used on the soundtrack.

results.title: The Existentialist cowboy's last stand
results.brief_description: Trapped up on a ridge, surrounded by a mean posse, a cowboy ponders his predicament - seeing it as a metaphor for life. Based on the book of the same name, this is French existentialism in a mid-Western American metaphor.
results.description: Trapped up on a ridge, surrounded by a mean posse, a cowboy ponders his predicament - seeing it as a metaphor for life. Based on the book of the same name, this is French existentialism in a mid-Western American metaphor.
